title: How bad are PFAS affecting us?
subtitle: As of 2022, 57% of all monitored sites across surface water bodies in the EU exceed the annual average environmental quality standards (EQS) for PFOS.
textNote:
For groundwater, no EU EQS is specified only values for surface water is visualized. Trifluoroacetic acid (TFA) is a highly persistent degradation product of other PFAS, including some pesticides, and can remain in surface and groundwater for long periods. PFOS is a priority substance under the EU Water Framework Directive, with environmental quality standards of 0.65 ng/l for inland surface waters, 0.13 ng/l for coastal and transitional waters, and 9.1 µg/kg (wet weight) for biota.
No data for Austria, Cyprus, Denmark, Greece, Hungary, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Slovenia, Slovakia.
extraInfo_CZ: 42 µg/kg in a Czech poppy seed bun
extraInfo_DE: 310 µg/kg in wheat flour (produced in Germany)
extraInfo_EL: 17 µg/kg in Greek rusks with olive oil
extraInfo_HU: 31 µg/kg in Hungarian coarse oat flakes
extraInfo_PL: 62 µg/kg in Polish spelt toast bread
extraInfo_PT: Data from 2018 and only one monitored site
extraInfo_RO: 49 µg/kg in corn flour from Romania
customUnitLabel: of monitored sites exceed PFOS EQS
